channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CAMEL-20033] Camel JBang dependency is not supporting Windows path with Camel files written in Java
item.description:
follow-up on CAMEL-19922 where I tested only with a Camel xml file

jbang camel@apache/camel init WithJava.java
jbang camel@apache/camel dependency copy --output-directory="c:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\testJbang\outputdir" "c:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\testJbang\WithJava.java"

results in error:

java.nio.file.InvalidPathException: Illegal char <      > at index 22: c:UsersAurelien Pupier   estJbangWithJava.java
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsPathParser.normalize(WindowsPathParser.java:182)
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsPathParser.parse(WindowsPathParser.java:153)
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsPathParser.parse(WindowsPathParser.java:77)
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsPath.parse(WindowsPath.java:92)
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsFileSystem.getPath(WindowsFileSystem.java:232)
        at java.base/java.io.File.toPath(File.java:2387)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportBaseCommand.copySourceFiles(ExportBaseCommand.java:460)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportCamelMain.copySourceFiles(ExportCamelMain.java:306)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportCamelMain.export(ExportCamelMain.java:102)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.Export.export(Export.java:127)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.DependencyList.doExport(DependencyList.java:207)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.DependencyList.export(DependencyList.java:64)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportBaseCommand.doCall(ExportBaseCommand.java:216)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.Export.doCall(Export.java:28)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.DependencyList.doCall(DependencyList.java:54)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.CamelCommand.call(CamelCommand.java:71)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.CamelCommand.call(CamelCommand.java:36)
        at picocli.CommandLine.executeUserObject(CommandLine.java:2041)
        at picocli.CommandLine.access$1500(CommandLine.java:148)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.executeUserObjectOfLastSubcommandWithSameParent(CommandLine.java:2461)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2453)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2415)
        at picocli.CommandLine$AbstractParseResultHandler.execute(CommandLine.java:2273)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.execute(CommandLine.java:2417)
        at picocli.CommandLine.execute(CommandLine.java:2170)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.CamelJBangMain.run(CamelJBangMain.java:165)
        at main.CamelJBang.main(CamelJBang.java:36)

jbang camel@apache/camel init demo.xml
jbang camel@apache/camel dependency copy --output-directory="c:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\testJbang\outputdir" "c:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\testJbang\demo.xml"

is working
item.summary: Camel JBang dependency is not supporting Windows path with Camel files written in Java

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
It may also be piccoli or something that regard \t as a tab char

Can you try with a different name than \test

same error:

jbang camel@apache/camel dependency copy --output-directory="c:\ws\withtouttandspaces\outputdir" "c:\ws\withtouttandspaces\WithJava.java"
java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: c:wswithtouttandspacesWithJava.java
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsException.translateToIOException(WindowsException.java:85)
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsException.rethrowAsIOException(WindowsException.java:103)
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsException.rethrowAsIOException(WindowsException.java:108)
        at java.base/sun.nio.fs.WindowsFileSystemProvider.newByteChannel(WindowsFileSystemProvider.java:236)
        at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.newByteChannel(Files.java:380)
        at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.newByteChannel(Files.java:432)
        at java.base/java.nio.file.spi.FileSystemProvider.newInputStream(FileSystemProvider.java:422)
        at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.newInputStream(Files.java:160)
        at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.newBufferedReader(Files.java:2922)
        at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.readAllLines(Files.java:3412)
        at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.readAllLines(Files.java:3453)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportBaseCommand.copySourceFiles(ExportBaseCommand.java:460)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportCamelMain.copySourceFiles(ExportCamelMain.java:306)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportCamelMain.export(ExportCamelMain.java:102)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.Export.export(Export.java:127)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.DependencyList.doExport(DependencyList.java:207)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.DependencyList.export(DependencyList.java:64)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.ExportBaseCommand.doCall(ExportBaseCommand.java:216)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.Export.doCall(Export.java:28)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.DependencyList.doCall(DependencyList.java:54)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.CamelCommand.call(CamelCommand.java:71)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.CamelCommand.call(CamelCommand.java:36)
        at picocli.CommandLine.executeUserObject(CommandLine.java:2041)
        at picocli.CommandLine.access$1500(CommandLine.java:148)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.executeUserObjectOfLastSubcommandWithSameParent(CommandLine.java:2461)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2453)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2415)
        at picocli.CommandLine$AbstractParseResultHandler.execute(CommandLine.java:2273)
        at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.execute(CommandLine.java:2417)
        at picocli.CommandLine.execute(CommandLine.java:2170)
        at org.apache.camel.dsl.jbang.core.commands.CamelJBangMain.run(CamelJBangMain.java:165)
        at main.CamelJBang.main(CamelJBang.java:36)
given that all backslashes are remove dinthe erro rmessage, it smells that it is written in a properties file withotu using the Java API Properties and read from it using the Java API Properties.
Can you look in the file .camel/camel-jbang-run.properties what the content is after you try to run this on window, and paste here

the content is:

camel.main.sourceLocationEnabled=true
camel.main.modeline=true
camel.jbang.health=false
camel.jbang.console=false
camel.jbang.verbose=false
camel.jbang.backlogTracing=true
camel.jbang.camel-version=4.1.0
camel.jbang.kameletsVersion=4.0.1
camel.main.routesIncludePattern=file:c:\ws\testjbang\WithJava.java
dependency=mvn:org.apache.camel:camel-kamelet:4.1.0
dependency=mvn:org.apache.camel:camel-java-joor-dsl:4.1.0
dependency=mvn:org.apache.camel:camel-endpointdsl:4.1.0
dependency=mvn:org.apache.camel:camel-rest:4.1.0
dependency=mvn:org.apache.camel:camel-core-languages:4.1.0
dependency=mvn:org.apache.camel:camel-timer:4.1.0

which is invalid for a Java properties file, the backslashes should be escaped

Okay give it a try with latest code. This PR fixes this on windows
https://github.com/apache/camel/pull/11836

I will try tomorrow but I'm pretty sure it won't work as I tried similar thing previously and there were failing tests: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-19922?focusedCommentId=17771068&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17771068
Yeah I found a few other places where the properties are loaded and need to deal with windows. Pushed a fix so try with latest code tomorrow.

Now I have this error message:

File does not exist: file:c:\ws\withouttandspaces\WithJava.java

I checked the file exists:

C:\ws\withtouttandspaces>ls
WithJava.java

the content of camel-jbang-run.properties is:

camel.main.sourceLocationEnabled=true
camel.main.modeline=true
camel.jbang.health=false
camel.jbang.console=false
camel.jbang.verbose=false
camel.jbang.backlogTracing=true
camel.jbang.camel-version=4.2.0-SNAPSHOT
camel.jbang.kameletsVersion=4.0.0-RC1

I think it is missing the forward slash after file:
I have now the same error with the run command (which was working previously)

If i remove the check here, the run and the copy dependency commands are working.

I verified that this check is working on Linux.
Okay you are welcome to send that as a PR against main branch

I wanted to try to understand why it was not working on Windows and fix th check instead of removing the code and now... there is no more an error with the run and for the dependency copy I have a very different error:

Error resolving the artifact: org.apache.camel:camel-main:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT due to: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.apache.camel:camel-core-languages:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present): Could not transfer artifact org.apache.camel:camel-core-languages:jar:4.2.0-20231026.183443-13: C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-core-languages\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-core-languages-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar.11669484229527873553.tmp -> C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-core-languages\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-core-languages-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
Error resolving the artifact: org.apache.camel:camel-debug:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT due to: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.apache.camel:camel-management:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present), org.apache.camel:camel-bean:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present), org.apache.camel:camel-log:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present), org.apache.camel:camel-xml-jaxb:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present), org.apache.camel:camel-xml-jaxp:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present), org.apache.camel:camel-xml-io-util:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present): Could not transfer artifact org.apache.camel:camel-management:jar:4.2.0-20231026.183443-13: C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-management\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-management-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar.8112451449272733420.tmp -> C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-management\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-management-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
Error resolving the artifact: org.apache.camel:camel-health:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT due to: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.apache.camel:camel-health:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present): Could not transfer artifact org.apache.camel:camel-health:jar:4.2.0-20231026.183443-13: C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-health\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-health-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar.5280008041007383707.tmp -> C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-health\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-health-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
Error resolving the artifact: org.apache.camel:camel-timer:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT due to: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.apache.camel:camel-timer:jar:4.2.0-SNAPSHOT (present): Could not transfer artifact org.apache.camel:camel-timer:jar:4.2.0-20231026.183443-13: C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-timer\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-timer-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar.2173488258079153799.tmp -> C:\Users\Aurelien Pupier\.m2\repository\org\apache\camel\camel-timer\4.2.0-SNAPSHOT\camel-timer-4.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
Try with the released version when it comes out
